title: Strengthening Business Practical Competencies: Understanding Arterial Blood Gas (ABG) Analysis: Comparison of Online Instructional Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and biochemical concepts
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the seven key components of an ABG report: pH, PaCO₂, PaO₂, HCO₃⁻, SaO₂, BE, and Base Excess.
Learners can classify acid-base imbalance types (respiratory/metabolic, acidosis/alkalosis) with over 85% accuracy when interpreting ABG results.
Learners can compare the advantages and disadvantages of two instructional methods (recorded lectures/live lectures) and select the approach best suited to their learning style.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
